data.text:
TLJ sits firmly in my top 3, alongside Empire and Hope. 

Anyone who writes this movie off without giving it a proper chance deserves punishment, and that punishment will be to continue existing in the same world as it while not understanding its greatness.

While that Connix-Holdo thing bugs me a little bit, overall this is a truly great, and truly unique, Star Wars movie, and just an altogether amazing piece of cinema. It tackles the big SW themes in a way no other movie has, and reinvigorates the series.

Rey and Poe finally meeting 😌

The sneaky glimpse of the texts 👍

The kids acting out the battle with ‘action figures’ 😌👍

The boy subtly using the force to grab the broom👌gazing up at the sky, wearing Rose’s ring... the spark is lit. 😌😁

A beautiful, uplifting ending.

Binary sunset 😭 Shut up. I’m not crying - YOU’RE crying. Shut up.

And the shot of Luke fading away is one of the most beautiful images, accompanying the most bittersweet moment, in all of Star Wars.👌

Luke’s deception is cleverly handled (no footprints, etc), but the saber is a giveaway (and would be to Kylo if he wasn’t so blinded by rage). It took me several viewings to notice it. 🙄 Luke v Kylo as a whole is beautifully conceived and executed. Completely new, yet so right.

I like that the new walkers walk on their knuckles. 🦍

Luke’s brush-off 😆👌😎

Kylo force-shoving Hux into the wall, and Hux’s yelp 😂

I find the kiss disappointing. Given the moment - the adrenaline, the explosion behind them - it should have been an epic snog. Like Luke with his life-sapping effort, Rose should have put all her remaining strength into a giant, slobbery pash. But as it is, it’s...eh. 🤷🏻‍♂️

But as it’s probably a tiny chance, it’s obviously better that he live. Rose loves him, but I think she also sees his value to the Resistance, and sees it as greater than hers (he’s THE Finn, the hero) - hence her risking her life to save his. At least, that’s how I read it.👍

I get that Finn has, by the end, fully committed to the Resistance and ending the FO, but I didn’t think it made sense that he’d try and destroy the cannon by flying into it, knowing what it can do. But I realised this time he’d really be the only one who’d know it COULD work.

Skimspeeders kickin’ up red stuff👌

Rey blasting three TIEs with one shot 🤘😁

“Whoo! I like this!” This and catching rain off the Falcon are the only real moments of levity Rey has all movie. I love this bit. 😃👍

“Blow that piece of junk OUT OF THE SKY!” 😂

Caverns 👍😍

“Salt.” 
Why does the guy touch the salt at the edge of the bootprint? If you’re going to taste the ground, you taste a pristine part of the ground, not the part where some dude’s filthy boot has been. I mean, that’s ground-tasting 101, right? 🤷🏻‍♂️

“The Supreme Leader is dead.”
“Long live the Supreme Leader.” 👍

Poe scratching Beebs’s belly? 
😬😐😑😐😑😐😧🤢🤮
He’s a droid. Not a puppy. That’s dumb.🤦🏻‍♂️🤖✔️🐶❌

That portable console with two fold-down terminals looks like a prototype for Computer Battleship...😬
I mean, I HOPE that’s the case. For all I know she MIGHT be dead.🤷🏻‍♂️ I guess we’ll find out in Ep IX.

I’ve heard some complain that the movie killed Phasma - but we see no proof she’s dead. She survived a trash compactor on a planet that became a sun - a bit of fire and a fall won’t kill her. She’s like Jaws from the Bond movies - she just keeps coming back.

Beebs in the walker 👍😁

Finn v Phasma 👍

Finn Marty McFlyin’ it🤘

Phasma’s/Gwen’s eye peering out👁👌
I love how the threads converge in that single moment - “Execute,” the saber breaking and...

“You come from nothing. You’re nothing. But not to me.” So, Kylo tries to turn Rey by negging her? 🙄Sounds about right.

The Rey v Kylo force-off over the saber👌

“Let’s make this hurt.” Phasma, you sadist! 😍

Rey & Kylo v Guards
😯😁😛😳🤤👌🤘👍
Absolutely stunning. Astounding. Fricken AMAZING. Techically not a lightsaber fight per se, but it contains some of the best lightsaber usage of the series. Ridley and Driver both completely sell it, nail it, etc.

“They blow you up today, you blow them up tomorrow.” Not sure DJ fully comprehends the concept of blowing people up - specifically, that a person, by being blown up, is rendered incapable of blowing up the person who has blown them up. But...it’s just business?🤷🏻‍♂️🤔🙄😬

This part reminds me of Scott Pilgrim - “Actually, muchacho, I poured the soy in this cup, but I thought REAL HARD about pouring in in that cup - you know, in my mind’s eye or whatever.” Snoke just drank half-and-half, baby. 😂🤘🥛

“...he ignites it and kills his true enemy.” 
Like Palpatine, Snoke’s overconfidence is his weakness. He belittled Kylo in front of a cute girl he has a crush on. Big mistake, Snokey. 😬

Snoke, Rey and Kylo.
I’ve said it before, but Andy Serkis is incredibly good as Snoke. Snoke’s mastery of the force is impressive, too. It’s almost a shame he had to die. But he *did* have to die. Kylo’s arc demanded it.

BB-8 ‘disguised’ as a mouse droid, mimicking the beeps😁

Evil BB 👍

“I know where the nearest escape pods are.”
“Of course you do.”
😆

“Sir, I am almost afraid to ask...”
“Good instinct, Threepio - go with that.”
😁

PHASMA RETURNS!🤘
Heavy metal queeeeeen! 🎸💥

You’d think, given her proximity to Holdo, she’d at least attempt to learn what was going on, at Poe’s behest or otherwise, before joining in the mutiny. But there’s no indication of this. I don’t think it’s a massive flaw, but it’s a niggly thing that bugs me.

...but this time I noticed a problem with it, unless I’m still missing something. Connix. She’s on Poe’s side, and she’s on the bridge with Holdo. So, either she’d learn Holdo’s plan, which she’d likely report to Poe, or Holdo doesn’t trust Connix either, and doesn’t let her in.

Holdo is withholding her plan from Poe, as she doesn’t trust him, and, as the film places us with Poe (the male hero, who would usually know the plan), we don’t find out either. I love this subversion of the role such a character usually plays, by putting him in the wrong...

GHOST YODA!🤘👻

The way he’s introduced - FG of the panning shot 👌

And the scene - wisdom, jokes, lightning bolt - is brilliant.

“Page-turners they were not.” 🤣
“The greatest teacher, failure is.” 😌
“We are what they grow beyond - that is the true burden of all masters.” 😭

The finger touch 👉👈👌

Rey v Luke 🤘👌👍
Rey being a Skywalker or a Kenobi was never on the cards. So... Yeah. Not sure what that was about.

In The Clone Wars, Obi-Wan was shown to have left the love of his life behind to become a Jedi - that’s how much he valued the code. That, and seeing what happened to Anakin after HE got married and had kids, would probably have meant he never did so himself.

In the ‘Legends’ books, Luke married Mara Jade and bore a son - Ben. 🙄 Apart from Luke and Mara’s relationship feeling terribly forced (probably because it was done due to fan demand - funny, that), the prequels showed what a bad idea it was to begin with.
But let’s face it - people aren’t mad that Rey’s parents were junk traders; they’re mad that she isn’t the child of Luke or Obi-Wan.

The answer is...who cares? They weren’t important. Most Jedis would be ‘mudbloods’ - it stands to reason - making Rey the rule, not the exception. Look at Ezra Bridger, whose parents we DO learn about - as far as we know, they were non-force-sensitive (force-insensitive?).

Because Jedis don’t HAVE kids. They don’t fall in love. They don’t FORM ATTACHMENTS. The only reason Luke and Leia (and by extension Kylo) exist is because Anakin BROKE THE RULES. Who were Obi-Wan’s parents? Who were Yoda’s? Mace Windu? Kanan Jarrus? Plo Koon? Kit fricken Fisto?

It’s weird that some “fans” are so disappointed about this. Not that we’ve been shown much, but it’s likely that most Jedis were in a similar situation - not that their folks were filthy junk traders who sold them off for drinking money, but that their folks were not Jedis.

Mirror cave.
Rey is her own parents! 🤯
No. But close enough. The scene is like some crazy avant-garde, experimental thing - but it works. And the truth it reveals, that Rey’s fate is down to her - is brilliant. I love that it subverts the ‘bloodline’ thing. Rey is Rey is Rey. 👍

“Let the past die. Kill it if you have to. That’s the only way to become who you’re meant to be.” Kylo sums up another theme.👌And it’s the most exciting one. Yet the most divisive, apparently. But the most exciting. 👍

“Don’t let the wrapper fool ya, friend.” DJ sums up a major theme. 👍

Stuttery BDT🤘

Beebs machine-gunning coins at the guard 😂 then blowing the barrel 🤷🏻‍♂️ sure, why not? 👍

Rose with the kid 😌😍👌

I like the callback to the TFA quadjumper in the fathier chase. 
🚀💥

I’m ashamed to say I’ve never seen Rashomon, but I’ve seen the ‘biased testimony’ device used elsewhere. I love the way it’s implemented here. It carries on the truth-as-POV theme, reveals a lot about characters, and provides context. Plus, Kurosawa reference - very Star Wars 👍

Rey practising with the staff, switching to the saber👌 

I’m thinking she’s gonna go the double-blader in Ep IX, Maul stylz. That said, I’m not gonna feel betrayed and whinge if she doesn’t...🙄

“I wish I could put my fist through this whole lousy, beautiful town.” Beautifully cheesy noirish line from Rose. 😍👌

I like the fakeout with the Master Codebreaker - this mythical, foppish, Bondian figure we never get to properly meet. 

I wish Lily Cole had a bigger part.😔

Canto Bight casino👌

“Look closer.” I love this bit. We see how the war affects some of the non-military, non-political population, and how some people exploit it for profit. We also get some insight into Rose, her background and her motivations. 👍

And the “not my Luke” people seem to have missed an important thing: he puts his fear aside and reconnects with the force, facing Kylo and renewing hope, as Leia wanted. He’s a changed man, who changes BACK. He literally gives his all to kickstart the Resistance. PEACEFULLY.🤘

I don’t think he’s a coward, as some have said. He’s afraid, but he has reason to be. His job was to continue the Jedi, but he helped create a Sith. Rey is as powerful as Kylo, and she lets the dark in. He fears making things worse. Luke’s doubt, caution, and fear are justified.
He comes off to Rey - and us - like a bit like a crazy conspiracy nut, but he would do if he’s had all this stuff rattling around in his head for ages with no-one to vent it to.

Luke’s crisis of faith is interesting. He’s done some reflecting since The Kylo Incident, examined his actions and those of past Jedi, and drawn conclusions. He may not be right about everything (his truth depends on his own POV), but he makes some interesting points.
The amount of thought RJ has put into the character and where he’s at at this point is incredible, and Mark Hamill, initial reservations or no, has never been better in the role.

I loved Luke as a kid, but went off him a bit as I got older, because he seemed a bit lame (though these rewatches have reminded me otherwise). But grown-up me loves him in this movie. He’s a far more rounded, more human character.

I like that Rey’s pleas to Luke sound rehearsed, like she’s been practising what she’s going to say. At least, I HOPE that’s why they sound like that.

“That’s the force!” Luke messing with Rey 😂

“What do you see?” I really like this reiteration of what the force is/does. 👍
It makes the ancientness of the Jedi more apparent, as indicates the vast potential of the force, in a way we haven’t seen in the movies before. 👌🤘

Its being on Ahch-To suggests that the early Jedi used the force on the same scale Luke does (not to the point of death, obvs, but, y’know, big), meaning this is not a ‘new’ ability, but that later Jedi maybe became smaller-scale or just more practical in their use of the force.

I assume the pool in the cave is some sort of force resonator, to amplify and channel force energy, allowing Luke to connect to Leia and project his image to Crait. The fact that it vibrates as Luke reaches out to Leia suggests as much. I love this idea.

The Rey-Kylo connections are a masterstroke, and done with good old shot framing, blocking and editing - no effects necessary. The way their relatationship develops, as do they as individual characters, is👌

The caretakers 😄

Wordless exposition - Haysian smelt implies a connection to Paige. Rose crying and holding it implies a CLOSE connection to Paige 👍

Love Maz’s cameo 😂🤘

ROSE TICO🤘😍
The hate for Rose baffles me - if not the product of sexism and/or racism. She’s a wonderful character - optimistic, kind, compassionate, pure-hearted, but brave, committed and determined. And KMT is not only great in the role, she lights up the goddamn screen ffs.

Holdo’s dressing-down of Poe - expertly delivered by Dern. 👌😍

And Finn persists in thinking Rey needs saving...

Not sure if these were the same people who decried Ackbar’s demise...

An intelligent but softly spoken woman with purple hair - not admiral material. 

An ancient flappy-mouthed squidbilly dude - admiral af. 🙄

Laura Dern 👍👍😍
Holdo 🤘💜

“That’s Admiral Holdo? Not what I expected.” What was that people were saying recently about her not looking like an admiral? They fell into the same trap as Poe - judging someone on their appearance. He misjudges her constantly and is proven wrong.

Meh riddance, Admiral Squidpappy. 🦑😵🤷🏻‍♂️ 

We shan’t fall prey to sentimentalism,
Nor let nostalgia’s sting our courage sap;
Forge on, Resistance, dwell not on the fallen,
Nor overstate their worth, for... https://t.co/RboGaeQ0xi

Chewie and the porgs 😂

Luke-Artoo reunion 😌

“That was a cheap move.” 😂😌👍

And as for not dying... 🤷🏻‍♂️ maybe it’s a ‘force’ field, maybe the midichlorians are sustaining her, or maybe she IS Mary fricken Poppins. It’s MAGIC. How it works is irrelevant. And if you’ve ever seen Mary Poppins, you’ll know she’s fricken awesome anyway. AND cool, y’all.

It makes sense for a life-or-death situation like this to trigger her power, doesn’t it? And as for the feat itself, she’s not flying, obviously - she’s in a zero-G environment and is pulling herself toward the ship. On the force power difficulty scale it’s pretty low.

“Leia Poppins”
I don’t understand the hate for this bit either. No, we haven’t seen Leia use her power before, but that’s not to say she hasn’t done so, or at least had lessons in how to (her brother is a Jedi Master, after all).

Kylo’s fighter🤘

The Kylo-Leia connection 😌

I love this exchange. No Star Wars movie has addressed this kind of thing before, yet it feels RIGHT for Star Wars. I love that this movie deals with this stuff. No only does it play to the big themes, it enriches and humanises the characters. It’s more grown-up Star Wars.

“You start an attack, you follow it through.” Very macho-man POV from Poe, absolutely in character.
“There are things you cannot solve by jumping in an X-wing and blowing something up - I need you to learn that.” Leia is his Yoda, teaching him the true nature of things.

Sea cow milky teats 😂 
The way Luke stares at Rey while drinking, like he’s trying to gross/freak her out 😆

I love the temple-tree scene - the tense conversation. “Why are YOU here?”👌
“What did you think was going to happen here? Do you think that I came to the most unfindable place in the galaxy for no reason at all?” ‘Nuff said, Lukey.
Snoke really is a lot better in this one - but he’s got more to do, I suppose. He’s still no Palpatine, but Andy Serkis is SO good, and RJ’s given him some wonderfully juicy dialogue.

Snoke’s throne room 😍

Snoke’s golden dressing gown 😍

Snoke being an average-sized dude instead of a human chihuahua 😠

The way he coldly whispers,
“Take that ridiculous thing off.” 👍

The little lightning zap, sending Kylo flying ⚡️👍
I am pro-porg.

An almost perfect moment. It tells us without words exactly where Luke is at, it undercuts the grandiosity of TFA’s cliffhanger, and it’s just plain funny af. One of my all-time favourite Star Wars moments.

Luke takes the saber, gazes at it silently, remembering. Looks up to see Rey’s expectant face, as the music builds, then stops, increasing our suspense...

...and piffs the stupid thing over the cliff.

...Paige Tico!🤘Veronica Ngo!👍😍
Paige’s whole sequence is so great - dramatic, suspenseful, moving, beautifully staged and shot. I love it.

The look on Hux’s face as the dreadnought explodes 😂

The chain reaction of exploding bombers 😟😱It’s like a Hindenburg-scale catastrophe, yet weirdly captivating to watch.

And we swing around to take in the one surviving bomber, specifically the little gunner bubble, and inside we find...

I love the big, lumbering bombers. Despite looking different, they do remind me of WWII bombers, escorted by fighters... I reckon they’re awesome. You can argue gravity, magnetism, propulsion or whatever, but as far as I’m concerned they’re consistent with what’s come before.

Threepio taking exception to being called nervous, as though it’s not his default setting 😆

Poe’s handbrake turn🤘
Reminds me a bit of Eagle 5’s “space tracks” in Spaceballs - thankfully sans actual tracks. And the fact he does it through the burning turret👌

Poe defying orders - interesting direction. It’s the logical evolution of the ‘cocky flyboy’ type Poe embodies - the swaggering, arrogant ‘alpha’ who thinks he can do no wrong. But, while he feels he’s doing right, he lacks Leia’s experience, foresight and strategic acumen.

Canady’s awesome - gruff, no-nonsense British navy type.🤘
I wouldn’t like to be under his command necessarily, but as a character I like him.

Beebs plugging the ‘leaks’ in Poe’s X-wing 😂👍

“General Hugs” 😂😌 This is the same kind of “tooling” Poe did with Kylo in TFA. It’s completely in character. Poe is belittling a fascist git, as all fascists should be belittled. And it’s a stalling tactic. If you think SW is no place for jokes, you’ve never seen SW. 🤷🏻‍♂️

That dreadnought is so fricken metal🤘(and so is its wife)
Now, THOSE are some HOT ventral cannons - if ya know what I mean. 😉

Kate Dickie! Obligatory GoT-actor-as-FO-console-operator.

I think I preferred Leia’s wardrobe in TFA - more guerrilla fighter, less elderly senator.
